member.name: M:KP.GmailApi.AuthorizationDelegatingHandler.GetTokenAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get an access token. Will return an valid existing token or retrieves a new one if expired. Note that the token could still be invalid when revoked remotely or because of clock skew for example.
member.param: True to return an existing token if not expired, false to force retrieval of new token

member.name: M:KP.GmailApi.Builders.HistoryQueryStringBuilder.SetLabelId(System.String)
member.summary: Only return messages with a label matching the ID.
member.param: the label ID

member.name: M:KP.GmailApi.Builders.HistoryQueryStringBuilder.SetMaxResults(System.UInt32)
member.summary: The maximum number of history records to return.

member.name: M:KP.GmailApi.Builders.HistoryQueryStringBuilder.SetPageToken(System.String)
member.summary: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.

member.name: M:KP.GmailApi.Builders.HistoryQueryStringBuilder.SetStartHistoryId(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Required. Returns history records after the specified startHistoryId. The supplied startHistoryId should be obtained from the historyId of a message, thread, or previous list response. History IDs increase chronologically but are not contiguous with random gaps in between valid IDs. Supplying an invalid or out of date startHistoryId typically returns an HTTP 404 error code. A historyId is typically valid for at least a week, but in some circumstances may be valid for only a few hours. If you receive an HTTP 404 error response, your application should perform a full sync. If you receive no nextPageToken in the response, there are no updates to retrieve and you can store the returned historyId for a future request.

member.summary: View and modify but not delete your email.

member.summary: Manage your basic mail settings.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.GmailScopes.ManageSensitiveSettings
member.summary: Manage your sensitive mail settings, including who can manage your mail. Note: Operations guarded by this scope are restricted to administrative use only. They are only available to Google Apps customers using a service account with domain-wide delegation.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.GmailScopes.FullAccess
member.summary: Full access to the account, including permanent deletion of threads and messages. This scope should only be requested if your application needs to immediately and permanently delete threads and messages, bypassing Trash; all other actions can be performed with less permissive scopes.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.LabelFields.Id
member.summary: The immutable ID of the label.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.LabelFields.LabelListVisibility
member.summary:
The visibility of the label in the label list in the Gmail web interface. Acceptable values are:
labelShow: Show the label in the label list. (Default)
labelHide: Do not show the label in the label list. ///
labelShowIfUnread: Show the label if there are any unread messages with that label.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.LabelFields.MessageListVisibility
member.summary:
The visibility of messages with this label in the message list in the Gmail web interface. Acceptable values are:
show: Show the label in the message list. (Default)
hide: Do not show the label in the message list.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.LabelFields.MessagesTotal
member.summary: The total number of messages with the label.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.LabelFields.MessagesUnread
member.summary: The number of unread messages with the label.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.LabelFields.Name
member.summary: The display name of the label.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.LabelFields.ThreadsTotal
member.summary: The total number of threads with the label.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.LabelFields.ThreadsUnread
member.summary: The number of unread threads with the label.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.LabelFields.Type
member.summary:
The owner type for the label. User labels are created by the user and can be modified and deleted by the user and can be applied to any message or thread. System labels are internally created and cannot be added, modified, or deleted. System labels may be able to be applied to or removed from messages and threads under some circumstances but this is not guaranteed. For example, users can apply and remove the INBOX and UNREAD labels from messages and threads, but cannot apply or remove the DRAFTS or SENT labels from messages or threads. Acceptable values are:
system: Labels created by Gmail.
user: Custom labels created by the user or application.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.LabelFields.All
member.summary: All the label fields

member.summary: The visibility of the label in the label list in the Gmail web interface.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.LabelListVisibility.Hide
member.summary: Do not show the label in the label list.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.LabelListVisibility.ShowIfUnread
member.summary: Show the label if there are any unread messages with that label.

member.name: T:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName
member.summary: Headers according to the RFC 2822, RFC 2369 and RFC 2919 Internet Message Format standard.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.Unknown
member.summary: Header is not a known type.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.Subject
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the subject.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.Comments
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores human-readable comments.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.References
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that is used to identify the thread to which this message refers.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.From
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the mail author(s).

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.To
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the primary mail recipients.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.Cc
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the carbon copied mail recipients.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.Bcc
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the blind carbon copied mail recipients.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.Keywords
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores human-readable keywords.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.Received
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that store additional tracing data.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.Sender
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the actual mail transmission agent, if this differs from the author of the message.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.Date
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the mail date.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ResentDate
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the date the message was resent.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ReplyTo
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the reply-to address.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.InReplyTo
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the message id of the message that to which this email is a reply.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.MessageId
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the message id.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ResentFrom
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the originator of the resent message.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ResentSender
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the transmission agent of the resent message.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ResentTo
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the recipients of the resent message.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ResentCc
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the carbon copied recipients of the resent message.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ResentBcc
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the blind carbon copied recipients of the resent message.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.OrigDate
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that consists of the field name "Date" followed by a date-time specification.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ReturnPath
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that store the tracing data for the return path.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.MimeVersion
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores the MIME version.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ContentType
member.summary: The name of the MIME header that stores the content type.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ContentTransferEncoding
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2822 header that stores a single token specifying the type of encoding.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.DkimSignature
member.summary: The name of the RFC 4871 header DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM).

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ListHelp
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2369 header that is the most important of the RFC 2369 headers. It would be acceptable for a list manager to include only this field, since by definition it SHOULD direct the user to complete instructions for all other commands. Typically, the URL specified would request the help file, perhaps incorporating an HTML form for list commands, for the list, and alternatively provide access to an instructive website.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ListSubscribe
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2369 header that describes the command (preferably using mail) to directly subscribe the user (request addition to the list).

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ListUnsubscribe
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2369 header that describes the command (preferably using mail) to directly unsubscribe the user (removing them from the list).

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ListPost
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2369 header that describes the method for posting to the list. This is typically the address of the list, but MAY be a moderator, or potentially some other form of submission. For the special case of a list that does not allow posting (e.g., an announcements list), the List-Post field may contain the special value "NO".

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ListOwner
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2369 header that identifies the path to contact a human administrator for the list. The URL MAY contain the address of a administrator for the list, the mail system administrator, or any other person who can handle user contact for the list. There is no need to specify List-Owner if it is the same person as the mail system administrator (postmaster).

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ListArchive
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2369 header that describes how to access archives for the list.

member.name: F:KP.GmailApi.Models.HeaderName.ListId
member.summary: The name of the RFC 2919 header, see https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2919.txt for more info.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Label.MessageListVisibility
member.summary: The visibility of messages with this label in the message list in the Gmail web interface.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Label.LabelListVisibility
member.summary: The visibility of the label in the label list in the Gmail web interface.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Label.Type
member.summary: The owner type for the label. User labels are created by the user and can be modified and deleted by the user and can be applied to any message or thread. System labels are internally created and cannot be added, modified, or deleted. System labels may be able to be applied to or removed from messages and threads under some circumstances but this is not guaranteed. For example, users can apply and remove the INBOX and UNREAD labels from messages and threads, but cannot apply or remove the DRAFTS or SENT labels from messages or threads.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Label.MessagesTotal
member.summary: The total number of messages with the label.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Label.MessagesUnread
member.summary: The number of unread messages with the label.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Label.ThreadsTotal
member.summary: The total number of threads with the label.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Label.ThreadsUnread
member.summary: The number of unread threads with the label.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Label.IsSystemLabel
member.summary: If the is a system label.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Label.IsUserLabel
member.summary: If the is a user defined label.

member.name: M:KP.GmailApi.Models.Label.ToString
member.summary: A string with the values of the properties from this

member.name: T:KP.GmailApi.Models.LabelType
member.summary: The owner type for the label. User labels are created by the user and can be modified and deleted by the user and can be applied to any message or thread. System labels are internally created and cannot be added, modified, or deleted. System labels may be able to be applied to or removed from messages and threads under some circumstances but this is not guaranteed. For example, users can apply and remove the INBOX and UNREAD labels from messages and threads, but cannot apply or remove the DRAFTS or SENT labels from messages or threads.

member.summary: Custom labels created by the user or application.

member.name: T:KP.GmailApi.Models.Message
member.summary: An email message.

member.name: M:KP.GmailApi.Models.Message.#ctor
member.summary: An email message.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Message.Id
member.summary: The immutable ID of the message.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Message.ThreadId
member.summary:
The ID of the thread the message belongs to. To add a message or draft to a thread, the following criteria must be met:
1. The requested threadId must be specified on the Message or Draft.Message you supply with your request.
2. The References and In-Reply-To headers must be set in compliance with the RFC 2822 standard.
3. The Subject headers must match.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Message.HistoryId
member.summary: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Message.LabelIds
member.summary: List of IDs of labels applied to this message.

member.summary: The entire email message in an RFC 2822 formatted and base64url encoded string. Returned in messages.get and drafts.get responses when the format=RAW parameter is supplied.

member.name: P:KP.GmailApi.Models.Message.PlainRaw
member.summary: Get / set the entire email message decoded from the RFC 2822 formatted and base64url encoded string. Returned in messages.get and drafts.get responses when the format=RAW parameter is supplied.

member.name: T:KP.GmailApi.Opensslkey
member.summary: OpenSSL Public and Private Key Parser. Reads and parses: (1) OpenSSL PEM or DER public keys (2) OpenSSL PEM or DER traditional SSLeay private keys (encrypted and unencrypted) (3) PKCS #8 PEM or DER encoded private keys (encrypted and unencrypted) Keys in PEM format must have headers/footers . Encrypted Private Key in SSLEay format not supported in DER Removes header/footer lines. For traditional SSLEAY PEM private keys, checks for encrypted format and uses PBE to extract 3DES key. For SSLEAY format, only supports encryption format: DES-EDE3-CBC For PKCS #8, only supports PKCS#5 v2.0 3des. Parses private and public key components and returns .NET RSA object.

member.name: M:KP.GmailApi.Opensslkey.GetRsaFromPemKey(System.String)
member.summary: Decode PEM pubic, private or pkcs8 key.

Include messages from SPAM and TRASH in the results.
Only return messages with labels that match all of the specified label IDs

Include threads from SPAM and TRASH in the results.
Only return threads with labels that match all of the specified label IDs

member.name: M:KP.GmailApi.Services.ThreadService.DeleteAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Immediately and permanently deletes the specified thread. WARNING: This operation cannot be undone. Prefer threads.trash instead.
member.param: ID of the Thread to delete.

member.name: M:KP.GmailApi.Services.ThreadService.ModifyAsync(System.String,KP.GmailApi.Models.ModifyThreadInput)
member.summary: Modifies the labels applied to the thread. This applies to all messages in the thread.
member.param: The ID of the thread to modify
The input to modify a thread

member.name: M:KP.GmailApi.Services.ThreadService.UntrashAsync(System.String)

member.param: The ID of the thread to remove from Trash
